messageBody:
My experience:

- I started by using the Swing runner because I really liked the dynamic
reloading of the classes.
- I then discovered Cygwin and Ant and since then I totally dropped the Swing
runner (never used it once). The reason is simple: I run all the tests, all
the time, I don't have reloading problem, I can work with xml without modifying
the excluded.properties file.

I do not define a main() method in my test cases and I prefer to type
ant test
rather than
java [package's hierarchy I never remember].MyClass

I think the documentation should first present the
java junit.swingui.TestRunner myClass
alternative rather than the
main() { junit.swingui.TestRunner(myClass); }

But it's a matter of taste.

My 2 cents

-Vladimir

--
Vladimir Bossicard
www.bossicard.com
